main event: A bright white, circular object smaller than a star with a distinct, pulsating light was observed over the mid-Atlantic for 6-10 seconds.
interesting points: The object disintegrated and broke up into many smaller objects.
The object had a long trail appearing 30 to 100 miles long.
Another sighting reported seeing white circular objects with bright lights at high speeds and with a tremendous rate of turn at approximately 21,000 feet over the mid-Atlantic.
The object was described as being half the size of the moon and very bright.
The object was initially observed as one and then broke up into three smaller parts before disintegrating.
sighted object: Bright white, circular object with pulsating light
witnesses: Military personnel and a civilian pilot
photographs: No photographs included in the report
